item.title: Comic Con Tampa 2016 2nd Annual Manly Man Facial Hair Contest
item.content:encoded:
Some friends and I decided to attend Comic Con in Tampa this year as we missed out on last years' Con. The day before, I noted there would be a beard contest there. With much excitement, we found the the room hosting the contest. I noticed and nodded to the other bearded men in the room as I sat down, scanning around for any additional beards entering the room as we waited. I was very curious to see how the contest would be judged.

I waited for my category to be announced. Yet again another "Grizzliest" category just like the Renaissance Festival. Once announced, we headed forward to the stage and lined up. The boisterous fellow announcing the contest held his hand over each of us and called upon the crowd to make noise if they liked that particular gent and his beard. After myself and a handful of other gents were selected to move up on to the stage. The announcer began going down the line asking us wacky questions about our beards. To my delight and surprise, I was selected the champion of the Grizzliest category! Thank you wonderful crowd for your kind screams of excitement for my follicles.

We stepped off stage, the category winners stepping to the side of the stage and the remaining beards taking a seat. We chatted a bit waiting for another category to be judged. After such, they announced that all the category winners would re-mount the stage for a final "Audience Choice" category. Yet again to my surprise and delight, I was selected! I smiled brightly and held my trophies high in the air in gratitude to the crowd.

What an experience! A great confidence boost for me as I look forward to the National Beard and Mustache Championships quickly approaching.
item.excerpt:encoded: 2016 Tampa ComicCon Manly Man Facial Hair Contest - Grizzliest and Audience Winner
item.dc:creator: sfoxorama@gmail.com

item.title: The 2016 Just for Men® National Beard & Moustache Championships®
item.content:encoded:
The 2016 National Championships are over! What a weekend filled with excitement, nervousness, and the BEARDS!

Some friends and I flew in to Nashville, TN for the competition. Friday evening, the competitors gathered in downtown Nashville for a procession through downtown. I'm sure you can imagine the reaction from all those on the streets at seeing hundreds of national caliber bearded gents barrelling through town. Lots of gawking, photos, and wide-eyed expressions. An absolute hoot!

Saturday registration and pre-judging took place. I had originally registered for Full Beard Natural but MJ Johnson moved me into Garibaldi during pre-judging as I was still within the 8" length limit. Just barely, but still in there. 60 guys in Full Beard Natural so moving to Garibaldi was a great move. Very thankful to MJ. It was a pleasure to meet him, a great guy. A true ambassador of beards.

5:30pm we began to arrive at the Ryman Auditorium. We dressed, groomed, and mingled. Lots of great beards and awesome guys.

Garibaldi was category 17 of 18 so I had a few hours of enjoying the competition from the seats. It was much more casual and fun that I'd expected. Lots of goofing off and rowdiness. The panel of 5 judges each selected 1st, 2nd, 3rd picks individually, then a screen showed the tabulated results. I believe there were 7 judges but they'd rotate 2 out.

Lots of excitement and nerves going as my category lined up. I was 2nd in line of the 1st group of 2 groups of Garibaldi competitors. My name was called, I walked out, paused at the center front of stage, then walked down to nod to each of the judges, then back up the steps to line up.

The judges voted and narrowed down to the top 3. I did pretty well on this first round, landing into 2nd place for Garibaldi. There was another round to come.

They walked out, down to the judges and lined up for voting on top 3. Now, the 2 groups lined up for a final vote of the 6. I had some kind people in the audience calling my number 96.

The votes began to roll in. 1st, 2nd, and 3rd were selected. I ended up in 4th. I really wanted to place but not this time. Garibaldi 1st place winner Andrew Kloss was a super nice dude, I enjoyed meeting him.

All things considered, not bad for my first larger competition! Very thankful for the support of my lovely friends who came to support and cheer me on. I'm looking forward to the World Beard and Mustache Championships 2017.

http://www.nationalbeardchampionships.com/#results
item.excerpt:encoded: My experience competing in The 2016 Just for Men® National Beard & Moustache Championships® in Nashville, TN.
item.dc:creator: sfoxorama@gmail.com

item.title: Beard Care
item.content:encoded:
Good quality beard care products are essential to a healthy great looking beard. Here are are some of my favorite products.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="450.0"] Rockriver Beard Oil and Beard Balm - My favorite beard oil and balm. It will keep your beard healthy, prevent itching, and give your beard a touch of shine. Plus a fragrance that can't be beat. From Portland, OR.[/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="750.0"] Big T Woodworks Beard Combs - Combing your beard with these combs you'll know you're holding one of the most finely crafted combs on the planet. Smoothed and polished so you don't snag or damage any beard hair. Crafted with gorgeous wood. Handcrafted in North Central Texas[/caption]

item.title: AnalogBeards
item.content:encoded: Analogbeards is a photography project I started on Instagram in which I photograph bearded Gents I meet with a Fujifilm Instax Mini 90. Follow @analogbeards on Instagram and tag your beard photos on film #analogbeards
